headline.print_headline: China: Foreign Tourism Falls, And Smog May Be One Reason
headline.main: China: Foreign Tourism Falls, and Smog May Be One Reason

docs.lead_paragraph: Among the factors cited for the significant drop in the number of tourists this year to China were smog, the sluggish global economy, a stronger Chinese currency and the bird flu.

headline.print_headline: Key West Looks at Identity As It Plots Tourism Future
headline.main: Key West Looks at Identity as It Plots Tourism Future

docs.abstract: Divisive debate brews over the future of the identity of Key West, Fla, as the town weighs whether to embrace cruise ship tourism, with its reliable stream of revenue, or move toward its artsy, wealthier side.
docs.lead_paragraph: A divisive debate brews over the future of the Florida town’s identity as it weighs whether to embrace cruise ship tourism or move toward its artsier side.

docs.abstract: Lexicon | "Libel tourism" means suing for libel overseas in a court friendlier to one's case. Not a new concept, but there is a new development in this radio report: New York's law protecting writers from libel judgments abroad. [Marketplace Morning Report]

docs.abstract: New study shows thqt tourism spending increased 7 percent in New Jersey in 2000, to $30 billion, over 1999 figure (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Tourists' spending in New Jersey increased last year by 7 percent over 1999, compared with an average increase of only 1 percent nationwide, according to a study released last week. Tourists spent $30 billion in New Jersey in 2000 by making 169.1 million trips to or within the state, an increase from the 166.9 million trips the previous year. Canadians accounted for the largest number of tourists from a foreign country with 710,000 trips. Karen DeMasters
